roleset.name: cause an increase (in interest, etc)

role.descr: instrument, if agent is also present

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: For the paper industry specifically , most analysts said the deal will spur a wave of paper - company takeovers , possibly involving such companies as Union Camp Corp. , Federal Paperboard Co. and Mead Corp.

propbank.arg: a wave of paper - company takeovers , possibly involving such companies as Union Camp Corp. , Federal Paperboard Co. and Mead Corp.

example.name: passivized instrumental subject
example.text: This month 's Friday - the-13th market plunge spurred by UAL news was n't as bad for the Jacobson specialists as yesterday 's action .

propbank.arg: This month 's Friday - the-13th market plunge

example.name: agentive subject
example.text: Indeed , Winnebago said it started `` several promotional programs '' to spur retail sales in the fall and winter .

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: It 's not just the responsibility of schools and teachers to spur children 's interest in language .

roleset.note: SPUR-V NOTES: Frames file for 'spur' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. Comparison to 'stimulate' (from spur.01-v predicate notes)
